title.narrative: POLICY MONITORING AND EVALUATION

description.narrative: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue and evidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and the reduction of their main inequalities., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue and evidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and the reduction of their main inequalities.

participating-org.narrative: FUNDACION DE UNIVERSIDAD COSTA RICA PARA LA INVESTIGACION

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers - social protection data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Support to other social protection programs: Child care and early childhood development

related-activity.ref: 1020/A0/06/003 SOCIAL INCLUSION, PUBLIC ADVOCACY AND COMMUNICATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue and evidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and the reduction of their main inequalities.

description.narrative: In the line of improving the generation and availability of relevant and timely information on the situation of children, the most important 2019 results resided in the completion of the EMNA Survey (MICS 6); the design of monitoring systems and baselines for innovative models; the implementation of RBM workshops and construction of programme Theories of Change with key counterparts; and the development of tools and guidelines for child-focused programme and policy evaluations. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/02/2020

title.narrative: Mid-term evaluation of the National Childhood and Adolescence Agenda (ANNA) implemented.

baseline.value: Programmed evaluation by the Monitoring & Evaluation system of the ANNA presented to the National Children and Adolescents Council (CNNA) in 2016.

target.value: 2021:The recommendations of the evaluation have been included in the updated ANNA and CNNA Action Plan.

actual.value: 2019:In process the implementation of the evaluation.

title.narrative: National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures

baseline.value: The country makes the two measurements of poverty in childhood, the multidimensional and by means of the monetary poverty line.

target.value: 2022:The Country has a proposal to mesuare mutidimensional poverty

title.narrative: Developed a training strategy on Results Based Management (RBM) for the childhood and adolescence institutional sector.

baseline.value: The institutions that make up the childhood and adolescence sector dont implement an RBM approach.

target.value: 2020:At least two institutions from the childhood and adolescence institutional sector have implemented an RBM/ToC approach.

actual.value: 2020:One institution iniated the implementation of ToC: RIAIIM and SUN (Interagencial Group)

title.narrative: Developed a proposal for the design and critical path of a Quality Assurance Management Model targeted towards children and adolescents public services.

baseline.value: There is no Quality Assurance Management Model for children and adolescent services.

target.value: 2022:All institutions from the Childhood and Adolescence sector have been accredited for the quality of their services.

actual.value: 2019:In process the conceptual development of the "Defensorías Juveniles" proposal.
